thread.title: 'Seamus is a major blow' – O'Neill saddened by Coleman injury
thread.title_full: 'Seamus is a major blow' – O'Neill saddened by Coleman injury

title: 'Seamus is a major blow' – O'Neill saddened by Coleman injury
text:
0 Mar 24, 2017 23:15:10 A rash challenge on the Everton defender left him in the hospital with a broken leg 
Martin O'Neill was left to lament a "major blow" after Seamus Coleman suffered a broken leg in the Republic of Ireland's 0-0 World Cup qualifying draw with Wales. 
Bale showing costs Wales 
Coleman was on the receiving end of a wild lunge from Neil Taylor 21 minutes from the end of Friday's otherwise unremarkable clash in Dublin, as Ireland lost top spot in Group D to Serbia. 
The Everton defender's sickening injury was all too apparent and O'Neill's first thoughts were for the 28-year-old, who was taken to hospital. 
"It's a bad break. He's a fantastic player and character. It's a major blow for the lad, his club and us," the Ireland boss told Sky Sports . 
"Apparently it wasn't the best challenge in the world – I haven't seen it. He's gone to hospital. I saw his reaction immediately and it didn't look good. He was holding is leg up and it didn't look good. Hope seamus Coleman gets better soon. Horrible tackle — Wayne Rooney (@WayneRooney) March 24, 2017 
"We had a few things to overcome this week. We have a really great spirit. 
"Seamus is a major blow – at the end of it all the most important thing is Seamus' health." 
Horrific challange nah man get well soon seamus bro i know mentally he's the man to come back better stronger from this @Everton — Yannick Bolasie (@YannickBolasie) March 24, 2017 Related
